page.title: 20INFORMATION SYSTEMS - PANTON
page.content: One of the biggest problems with living in the heart of the countryside is the dissemination of information. A library visits {PANTON }once every two weeks and stops at three pr-arranged places for a duration of ten minutes. This is a useful service but too rigid and brief to be anything other than a poor substitute for a permanent amenity. To publicise any meeting or event notices are put in the post office at Barkwith and Wragby and even then it is very likely that people will not see them. There is no central place of information for residents of {PANTON. }People have to rely very heavily on word of mouth to be fully acquainted with local events and news.As a result there is very little likelihood of the emergence of pressure groups or protest for better services or conditions in rural areas.
